availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Charles Ertman Aulick (Pendleton County, KY, farmer)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Arthena B. Dudley Aulick in Harrison County, Kentucky, on January 30, 1840. Father of Napoleon B. Aulick, James A. Aulick, Charles J. Aulick, Wesley W. Aulick, Theophilus Aulick, Nancy F. Aulick, Albert T. Aulick, and Arthena A. Aulick. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1850. Farmer in Pendleton County in 1860. Owned four enslaved persons in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 365B.

Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 189A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 369A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, 1783-1965, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Harrison County Marriages, 1831-1892, Film #001690281, p. 84.
